reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Rocky Mountain Room for 1 night and found it to be VERY comfortable and clean. The rocking chairs are a nice touch, better than the leather chairs shown on the website. The waterfall shower is COOL!!! Enjoyed a nice dinner in the Steakhouse. Would recommend the Madonna Inn and look forward to staying again one day.
reviews.title: Fun Place!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Madonna due to the great reviews on trip advisor. We found this hotel to be uncomfortable and an overpriced tourist trap. Our room was in the "cave" part of the hotel. Although it was spacious, the curtains were dusty and torn. The carpet needed to be cleaned and the woodwork needed to be repainted. We had a plastic tree branch above our bed and the fake leaves actually fell off while we were sleeping!! This hotel was such a disappointment!
reviews.title: Overpriced tourist trap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night. It was a great experience. This place is so funky! Funky in a good way! We stayed in the Mountain Cabin Room. It was great, from the bed frame that looked like branches to the beautiful mural on the wall to the pine scent in the room to the real granite walls. The place was immaculate! I was a little worried with all of the funky decorations that it might just be old and not very clean, but I have never been in a cleaner hotel room. They keep it in great condition. Was truly a great experience. The restaurant is a bit expensive, but still fun.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Overall, if you're in the area and looking for a cool place to stay, this is the place.
reviews.title: what a great place.. A Dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: l tell everyone about the Madonna Inn, had a great stay.. on the way to big sur.. one night only.. see all the other reviews ..
reviews.title: Good fun if a little dated

reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel. It is not your regular hotel - if you are looking for a great service in a business-like setting, this is not for you. It should be viewed as an adventure, an experience. Some rooms are not the most comfortable I have ever been but still ots of fun for a couple of days.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The food is not perfect, but quite good steaks. Try the Secret packages that give you cheaper night and sometimes the food as well.
reviews.title: Great fun hotel
Loved every minute of it!
reviews.text: The Madonna Inn is a great fun hotel to stay at. We picked our room in advance and chose the Barrel of Fun room. I can highly recommend this room - we even had our own fireplace with a log provided! The steaks in the restaurant are superb as is the service. This hotel is highly recommended for having some fun and making you smile. A tad on the expensive side but if it's part of a special trip then it's definitely worth it.

Stayed in the Jungle Rock Room for 1 night and then the Chesnut Foal for 2 nights, and WOW what a place! We were going to stay in a normal Best Western or similar, but it was a holiday weekend, so everything was expensive and full, had already booked the Jungle Rock room for the Thursday night, so I rang back and asked how much the cheapest room would be for 2 more nights, so they told me of the the Chesnut Foal. When we arrived in the Jungle Rock room, what an experience, I loved every second in that room, I was in the waterfall shower for about an hour! When we were ready to leave that room, I rang the front desk and they told me to leave our bags where they were, they would move them for us, and when we got back later that night, sure enough our bags were there waiting for us, excellent service, especially as we had very heavy suitcases, and we were 2 flights up! The Chesnut Foal was a great room too (not so inpressive, but still cool!) All in all I would recommend anyone to stay here, just for the experience, we are definatley going back, and next time it will be the Caveman room. It is abit more expensive, but after working it out on a holiday weekend, it wasn't any more expensive than a big chain of hotels that all look the same! We also ate in the steak house, and that was great, we had ribs which were OK, nothing too special, but everything else was wonderful! Would recommend to anyone to go there, what a fantastic place!
reviews.title: On a two week trip around California this was our worst experience.
Monstrosity!
reviews.text: We had been told about this 'interesting ' place;booked ahead on a jouney from Hearst Castle down to LA.

reviews.title: Madonna Inn = Fantastic Voyage
reviews.text: The Madonna Inn is the place where outrageous design dreams come true. Not only is the realization of a beautiful, fantastical vision, it's situated in the beautiful California central coast.

The Madonna Inn isn't just whimsy, however. The staff is excellent (always in tune with the fun, trippy quality of the place) and professional, the beds are amazingly comfortable, and the ice buckets are padded and pink, like champagne.
reviews.title: It is not a hotel, it is an experience

reviews.text: Take note of the recurring themes -- ranchero-style, curly cut door moldings, local stone in fireplaces and bathrooms, and pink, pink, pink -- imagination everywhere.
reviews.title: A real hit with the kids!
Madonna Inn - quite an experience
reviews.text: The Madonna Inn is much more than the cave bathroom -- you need to stay overnight to really experience it! (Best done with a group of friends, so you can visit more than one room.) Hats off to Alex and Phyllis Madonna for creating this living masterpiece of Americana!
We stayed at Madonna inn back in 2002 when we visited Hearst Castle. My colleagues highly recommended it and I also really like it too.
reviews.title: A unique experience worth a try!
Like staying in a time warp!
reviews.text: I really loved this hotel. The rooms were kitchy and it was like staying in 1965. Our room was cute and clean and really cleverly decorated. Everyone who worked there was friendly and helpful and the property itself is nicely laid-out. The restaurant is especially lovely and has marvelous ambience. I would definitely stay here again.

If you've got a sense of humour and you're into kitsch, then this place is a must. It's what happens when Barbie moves in with Barnie Rubble, all pink and rock. Our room, Misty Rock, was on the ground floor. It was large and very comfortable, although you'd be better off in the upper floors if you want a view. The room had a waterfall shower, which was more for show than functional, but it also had a super duper massage shower head as well, so you could use both.
reviews.title: Barbie meets The Flinstones
Why didn't someone tell me
reviews.text: We booked a table in the restaurant so we didn't have to wait. The food was good, hearty American food and the service was very good. The fish was dry and overcooked, but the steak was melt-in-your-mouth, and given it's a steakhouse I suppose that's what you'd expect. There was also live music and a dance floor for those wanting to work up and appetite for dessert.
All in all it was a great place to stop for a unique hotel experience.
reviews.title: A complete pink-fest!
Love it!
reviews.text: Call me crazy, but when I spend $200 a night for a room, I don't want to hear everything in the next door room. The walls are paper thin and speaking in a whisper is too loud. Don't plan on sleeping when you're here. I knew that the rooms would be "tacky", but I thought that they would be clever "tacky." They weren't. This is a tourist trap extraordinaire.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to the Inn. I have always wanted to go, but my friends have always been...a little weirded out. Come on, where's your sense of humor and adventure?! Now, granted, I had my own pre-conceived notions- That the grounds would be covered with fetishists and porn stars, or other such opportunists taking advantage of the campy decor. But, I was pleasantly suprised to find that the Madonna demographic, was in fact, families and seniors. Even younger couples strolled around, enjoying dinner or the gift shop.
reviews.title: Not Creepy as Expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service in the Steakhouse and Coffee Shop was outstanding. The quality of the food was tops, and since we were celebrating our 1st Anniversary, they made it very special, with desert, a great booth and a balloon (cute touch).
reviews.title: Whoooo Hoooooo

likes.disliked: — Greasy food at the hotel's restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the "Barrel of Fun" room, which features a fireplace and rock shower. I was very skeptical of the, well, bacteria that could be in the shower, but the bathroom appeared to be very clean, save for a few ants on the windowsil. The room was HUGE, and could easily sleep 6+ people, but there is only one king bed and a couch by the fireplace.
reviews.title: Great Food... Terrible Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, in summary, my husband I and I really enjoyed our overnight stay. The location to downtown SLO couldn't be better. We will be back once they build the POOL!
reviews.title: Everyone has to stay here at least once!

reviews.text: We stayed in the Daisy Mae (A rock room next to the famous Caveman Room).
reviews.title: What a hoot - one of a kind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated our 20th anniversary in the Kona Rock room, featuring a huge rock fireplace and rock (but not waterfall) bathroom. As a previous reviewer suggested, it's good to go on the Inn website and check out the room photos and descriptions, although digital photos would give more detail. If in doubt about a room's features, call the Inn. I reserved several months in advance but was not able to get a waterfall shower, so plan ahead, because the room features are what makes your stay fun. I would caution those with foot or mobility problems that the floor in our bathroom and shower were also made of rock, making for an uneven, and occasionally, painful surface to walk on barefoot. We didn't dine in the steakhouse, but ate in the Copper Cafe (the coffee shop). You absolutely must check out the bakery selections, especially their cakes, which are covered with monstrous pink or chocolate curls. Although some of the features in the room are dated, you will definitely have more to e-mail home about than if you stayed at a chain motel/hotel. Everyone should visit at least once in their lifetime!
reviews.title: Anniversary Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and as expected it was an unusual place. Unfortunately we booked our room only 2 weeks beforehand and so all the 'best' rooms were already booked for our Saturday night stay.
reviews.title: we enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Merry room ($200p/n +tax) and it was very garish and amusing for the novelty factor. It was a fairly comfy and quiet room but the decor was a little more run down than i would have liked. On the plus side it was a large room, particularly the bathroom.
reviews.title: Fairy tale heaven

likes.disliked: — Can't afford to stay there longer

reviews.text: We got good service from staff, particularly in the restaurant (as it was our anniversary we received a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine, balloons and a desert!). Very good set up with the round booth tables and live music but unfortunately the quality of the food did not reflect the rest of the other excellent qualities about the restaurant. The steak and lobster meal my husband had was pricey and not a very good quality at all and pretty flavourless, and my meal was just ok, but the waitress was great and recommended an excellent bottle of wine from a local vineyard.
reviews.title: Fabulous place

likes.disliked: — Not receiving a reply to my email

reviews.text: The large area outside our room with swinging chairs etc to sit in made up for not having a private balcony which many of them overlooked this communal area anyway.
reviews.title: DO Believe the Hype!

reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Madonna Inn on a trip to Santa Barbara, Lompoc, Solvang, and Hearst Castle. My two daughters pored over the photos on the Madonna Inn website and selected the Sky Room- and it turned out to be as magical for us as it was for them!
reviews.title: Loved It! Loved It! Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sky Room is two stories, with the upstairs perfect for 1-3 children. It has a twin and full bed in what looks like an attic tower, so it was perfect for my fairy-tale-loving girls. They placed ALL their belongings in their corresponding nightstands, and they thought they were in a castle.
reviews.title: Fun place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downstairs, a king sized bed for us with a chandelier hanging overhead. A flat screen tv in the corner, elegantly funky pink bathroom with matching robes, all great fun.
reviews.title: I love this place more than ever!

likes.liked: — The accurate preservation of a truly unique historical place...ye it never felt old/creepy. Its well preserved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If there was any wear and tear in the room, I didn't notice it and my girls most definitely didn't either! They want to stay here again! In the same room, which seems like a shame with their being 107 other different rooms.
reviews.title: It's all about the Caveman Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the cafe and restaraunt are great, we opted to have breakfast at one off our favorites up the freeway a bit, at the Apple Farm- DELICIOUS!
reviews.title: Fabulous in every way - genuinely charming hotel.
Wow! Amazing!!
reviews.text: I stayed here for my honeymoon beginning of September and am really pleased I did!

Only stay here if you want to stay in an amazingly different, inspiring, pink and fluffly world. I can't believe the bad reviews about 'too much pink' - that's the whole point, you have to embrace it!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Great room - Gypsy Rocks and the waterfall shower was fantatsic. I told them it was my honeymoon and they brought us a bottle of fizz with our name on the label - very nice.
reviews.title: most unusal but fun

reviews.text: Great cocktails in the bar - had a lovely Martini.
reviews.title: Just (a little bit short of) Heaven

reviews.text: I HIGHLY recommend eating at the restaurant - the steak was superb (despite another review on here, it was the best steak I have ever eaten and I've tried a few!).
reviews.title: A Fantasy Hotel!!
